_meta.description: Pre-analyzed privacy scores for top 20 websites. Loaded on server startup for instant responses.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data across Google services and with partners for ads, analytics, and business purposes

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Extensive tracking across services using cookies, device identifiers, and activity logs

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses data to train and improve AI models including Gemini and other machine learning systems

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Retains data for varying periods; some data can be auto-deleted via user settings

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Industry-leading encryption and security infrastructure with regular audits

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Provides Google Dashboard and Takeout for data access/export, but opt-out options are complex

bullets: Collects vast amounts of data across all Google services including Search, YouTube, Gmail, and Maps
Combines data from multiple services to build detailed advertising profiles
Data is used to train AI and machine learning models
analysis.recommendation: Use privacy settings at myaccount.google.com to limit data collection, enable auto-delete, and review ad personalization controls.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares viewing data across Google ecosystem and with advertisers for targeted ads

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks watch history, search queries, comments, and interactions to build interest profiles

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses viewing patterns and interactions to train recommendation algorithms and AI models

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Watch and search history retained indefinitely unless manually cleared or auto-delete is enabled

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Secured by Google's infrastructure with strong encryption and access controls

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Users can pause watch/search history, but full data control requires navigating multiple settings

bullets: Tracks everything you watch to build detailed interest profiles for ad targeting
Data is shared across the entire Google ecosystem
Viewing patterns feed recommendation AI and are used for model training
analysis.recommendation: Pause watch and search history in YouTube settings, and use Google's auto-delete controls to limit data retention.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data extensively with Meta companies, advertisers, and third-party partners

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks activity on and off Facebook via Meta Pixel, cookies, and partner data

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses posts, photos, and interactions to train Meta AI and generative AI models

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Retains data for extended periods even after account deletion; some data kept indefinitely

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Has security measures but history of major data breaches raises concerns

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Provides data download and privacy checkup tools but opt-out processes are complex

bullets: Tracks your activity across millions of websites and apps through Meta Pixel and SDKs
Your posts, photos, and interactions are used to train AI models
History of significant data breaches affecting billions of users
analysis.recommendation: Review privacy shortcuts, limit off-Facebook activity tracking, and regularly audit connected apps and ad preferences.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data across Meta platforms and with advertising partners extensively

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks in-app behavior, DMs metadata, location, and cross-app activity via Meta technologies

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Photos, reels, and interactions used to train Meta AI and content recommendation systems

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Content and metadata retained for extended periods; deleted content may persist in backups

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Encryption for some features but DMs are not end-to-end encrypted by default

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Data download available but opting out of AI training requires specific requests

bullets: All photos, stories, and reels can be used to train Meta's AI models
Extensive cross-platform tracking shared with Facebook and WhatsApp
Direct messages are not end-to-end encrypted by default
analysis.recommendation: Set your account to private, limit data sharing in privacy settings, and submit an AI training opt-out request through Meta's privacy center.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with advertisers, business partners, and xAI for AI training purposes

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks interactions, browsing behavior, and uses third-party data for ad targeting

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Posts and interactions are shared with xAI to train Grok and other AI models by default

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Data retained while account is active; deactivated account data kept for 30 days

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Basic security measures in place but reduced trust & safety team raises concerns

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Users can download data and adjust privacy settings but AI training opt-out is buried in settings

bullets: Your posts are shared with xAI to train the Grok AI model by default
Extensive data sharing with advertisers and third-party partners
Reduced trust and safety team has raised security concerns
analysis.recommendation: Disable Grok data sharing in Settings > Privacy, review connected apps, and limit ad personalization.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Minimal data sharing with third parties; does not sell user data to advertisers

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Limited tracking with App Tracking Transparency framework giving users control

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: On-device processing for most AI features; Apple Intelligence uses differential privacy

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Clear retention policies with data minimization as a core principle

categories.label: Security
categories.note: End-to-end encryption for iCloud, iMessage, and FaceTime; strong hardware security

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Comprehensive privacy dashboard at privacy.apple.com with data download and deletion

bullets: Industry-leading privacy with on-device AI processing and end-to-end encryption
Does not sell user data or build advertising profiles
App Tracking Transparency gives users control over cross-app tracking
analysis.recommendation: Apple is one of the most privacy-respecting major tech companies; enable Advanced Data Protection for iCloud for maximum security.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with subsidiaries, sellers, advertisers, and service providers extensively

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks purchase history, browsing behavior, Alexa interactions, and device usage patterns

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses data to train Alexa AI, recommendation engines, and various ML systems

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Retains purchase and browsing data indefinitely; Alexa recordings stored until manually deleted

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Strong security infrastructure backed by AWS with encryption and access controls

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Data download available via Request My Data tool but deletion process is limited

bullets: Collects data from shopping, Alexa, Ring, Kindle, and all Amazon services
Alexa voice recordings are stored and used for AI training by default
Purchase and browsing history retained indefinitely
analysis.recommendation: Review Alexa privacy settings, delete voice recordings regularly, and manage ad preferences in your Amazon account.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with affiliates and partners; enterprise data handled separately with stronger controls

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks usage across Microsoft services and uses advertising IDs for personalization

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses data for Copilot and AI features but enterprise customers can opt out

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Varies by service; provides privacy dashboard to view and clear activity data

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Enterprise-grade security with BitLocker, Windows Hello, and strong encryption standards

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Comprehensive privacy dashboard at account.microsoft.com with granular controls

bullets: Collects diagnostic data from Windows, Office, and other services by default
Copilot AI features process user content but enterprise can opt out
Provides one of the better privacy dashboards among major tech companies
analysis.recommendation: Use the Microsoft Privacy Dashboard to manage data, set diagnostic data to minimum in Windows Settings, and review Copilot data usage.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with Microsoft affiliates, recruiters, enterprise subscribers, and ad partners

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks professional activity, connections, messages, and off-LinkedIn browsing via widgets

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses profile and activity data for AI features like job recommendations and content suggestions

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Profile data retained while account is active; some data persists after account closure

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Microsoft-backed security infrastructure with encryption and multi-factor authentication

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Data download available; privacy settings allow limiting visibility but ad opt-out is limited

bullets: Your professional data is shared with recruiters and enterprise subscribers
Tracks your browsing on sites with LinkedIn widgets embedded
Part of Microsoft ecosystem with data shared across affiliates
analysis.recommendation: Review visibility settings, limit off-LinkedIn data collection in ad preferences, and audit third-party app connections.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with advertisers and has licensed content to AI companies for training

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks browsing, votes, and interactions; uses cookies and third-party analytics

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Has licensed user content to Google and others for AI model training

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Posts and comments persist publicly; deleted content may remain in archives

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Standard security practices with 2FA available but past breach incidents

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Users can delete accounts and request data but public posts may persist in third-party archives

bullets: User content has been licensed to AI companies like Google for model training
Posts and comments are public by default and may persist in web archives
Growing advertising platform with increasing data collection
analysis.recommendation: Use a pseudonymous account, be mindful that posts are public and may be used for AI training, and review ad personalization settings.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with ByteDance affiliates and business partners; data access concerns from governments

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Collects device info, location, keystroke patterns, browsing history, and biometric data

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses all content and interactions to train highly sophisticated recommendation algorithms

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Unclear retention policies with data potentially stored in multiple jurisdictions

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Ongoing concerns about data access by Chinese government; Project Texas attempts to address

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Limited transparency and control options; data deletion requests may not cover all copies

bullets: Collects extensive biometric data including faceprints and voiceprints
Ongoing national security concerns about data access by Chinese government
Keystroke patterns and clipboard contents have been collected
analysis.recommendation: Limit permissions (camera, microphone, location), set account to private, and be aware that data may be accessible to ByteDance affiliates globally.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with service providers and for limited advertising on the ad-supported tier

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks viewing history, search queries, and device interactions for recommendations

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses viewing data to train recommendation algorithms and content matching systems

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Retains viewing history for the duration of account; provides profile-level viewing history management

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Strong security practices with encryption and regular security assessments

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Clear data access and deletion options through account settings

bullets: Detailed viewing behavior tracked for recommendation engine training
Ad-supported tier introduces additional data sharing with advertisers
Relatively transparent privacy practices compared to social media platforms
analysis.recommendation: Review viewing activity settings, consider the privacy trade-offs of the ad-supported tier, and use profile-level controls to manage data.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with advertising partners, podcast hosts, and third-party services

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks listening habits, playlists, and interactions to build taste profiles

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses listening data to train DJ AI, recommendation algorithms, and personalization models

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Listening history retained while account is active; data deletion available on request

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Standard encryption and security practices with OAuth for connected apps

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Privacy settings available but limited; data download through account settings

bullets: Detailed listening habits used to build taste profiles shared with advertisers
Podcast listening data may be shared with podcast creators and hosts
AI DJ and recommendation features rely heavily on behavioral data
analysis.recommendation: Review connected apps, manage social sharing settings, and consider that listening data shapes your advertising profile.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares metadata with Meta/Facebook for advertising despite end-to-end encryption of messages

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Collects metadata including who you talk to, when, and how often; shares with Meta

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Message content is encrypted but metadata and usage patterns may inform Meta AI systems

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Messages stored on device; metadata retained on servers for operational purposes

categories.label: Security
categories.note: End-to-end encryption for messages and calls by default; backup encryption optional

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Account deletion available but metadata already shared with Meta cannot be recalled

bullets: Messages are end-to-end encrypted but metadata is shared with Meta for ads
Contact lists, usage patterns, and group membership shared with Facebook
Cloud backups are not end-to-end encrypted unless explicitly enabled
analysis.recommendation: Enable encrypted backups, be aware that metadata is shared with Meta despite message encryption, and review privacy settings regularly.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with advertisers and business partners for targeted advertising

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Collects precise location data, device info, and content interaction patterns

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Snaps and interactions used to train My AI chatbot and AR lens recognition systems

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Snaps deleted from servers after viewing but metadata and Memories are retained longer

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Messages auto-delete but not end-to-end encrypted; Snap Map raises location privacy concerns

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Account deletion available; data download through account settings

bullets: Precise location data collected for Snap Map and advertising purposes
My AI chatbot conversations are used to train Snap's AI models
Snaps auto-delete but metadata is retained on servers
analysis.recommendation: Disable Snap Map or set to Ghost Mode, review My AI data usage settings, and limit location permissions.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with advertisers and partners for targeted advertising on the platform

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks pins, searches, and browsing to build interest profiles for ad targeting

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses interaction data to train visual search, recommendation, and shopping AI features

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Pins and boards retained while account is active; account deletion removes public content

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Standard security practices with HTTPS and access controls

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Clear privacy settings, data download, and account deletion options available

bullets: Interest-based profiles built from your pins and searches for ad targeting
Visual recognition AI trained on user-pinned content
Relatively straightforward privacy controls compared to other social platforms
analysis.recommendation: Review personalization and data settings in privacy preferences, and be aware that saved content informs your advertising profile.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with service providers and for safety; increasing focus on advertising

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks messages, voice channel usage, and server activity; new ad targeting being introduced

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses data for AI features like Clyde chatbot and auto-moderation; opt-out available

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Messages retained until deleted; server data persists as long as server exists

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Messages are not end-to-end encrypted; standard transport encryption only

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Data request and deletion available; privacy settings for AI features but increasingly complex

bullets: Messages are not end-to-end encrypted and can be read by Discord
Introducing advertising features that will increase data collection
AI features like Clyde use conversation data unless users opt out
analysis.recommendation: Opt out of AI data usage in settings, be mindful that messages are not encrypted, and review the new advertising data settings.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with Amazon affiliates, advertisers, and content creators for analytics

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks viewing habits, chat activity, and interactions across the platform

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Uses data for content recommendations and moderation AI systems

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Chat logs and viewing data retained; VODs have configurable retention periods

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Amazon-backed infrastructure with strong security practices

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Account settings provide some control; data download available through Twitch settings

bullets: Part of Amazon ecosystem with data shared across Amazon affiliates
Chat messages and viewing habits tracked for recommendations and analytics
Streamers receive analytics data about their viewers' behavior
analysis.recommendation: Review connected accounts, manage notification and chat settings, and be aware that viewing data feeds into Amazon's broader ecosystem.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Does not share personal browsing data; Brave Ads use anonymous confirmation tokens

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Built-in ad and tracker blocking; no user tracking for advertising purposes

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Leo AI processes queries locally or ephemerally; does not use browsing data for AI training

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Browsing data stays on device; Brave Search queries are not linked to users

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Strong security with HTTPS-by-default, built-in Tor mode, and fingerprinting protection

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Privacy-first design with granular controls and transparent open-source codebase

bullets: Privacy-first browser with built-in ad blocking and tracker protection
Brave Ads use anonymous tokens â€” no personal data leaves the browser
Open-source codebase allows independent verification of privacy claims
analysis.recommendation: Brave is one of the most privacy-respecting browsers available; enable Brave Shields for maximum protection and consider Brave Search for private searching.

categories.label: Data sharing
categories.note: Shares data with Microsoft affiliates and service providers; public repos are inherently open

categories.label: Tracking
categories.note: Tracks repository activity, contributions, and usage patterns for platform features

categories.label: AI training
categories.note: Public repository code used to train GitHub Copilot and other AI coding assistants

categories.label: Data retention
categories.note: Code and contributions retained in git history; account deletion removes profile but forks may persist

categories.label: Security
categories.note: Strong security with 2FA, SSH keys, CodeQL scanning, and Dependabot alerts

categories.label: User rights
categories.note: Granular repository visibility settings; Copilot opt-out available for individual and organization accounts

bullets: Public code repositories are used to train GitHub Copilot AI
Part of Microsoft ecosystem with data sharing across affiliates
Strong security features but limited control over how public code is used
analysis.recommendation: Set repositories to private when appropriate, opt out of Copilot training in settings, and enable 2FA for account security.
